page.title: 03May Day
page.content: who throw the petals come first then the guards and then the May Queen. Next comes the attendant. The others come behind. When we get to the chairs the petals are thrown and the May Queen sits on the throne with all the flowers on it. I was crowned by my Grandad. He made a speech. Then we say the May Day rhyme. We danced Bridge of Athlone, Cicassian Circle,Ocean Wave, Cumberland Square Eight and then the Infants danced Four Around Four. Then we all line up to sing spring songs. Winona and Rima played their recorders to accompany one of the songs. Last of all we danced three dances around the May Pole. They were Plaiting,Gypsy's Tent,and the Barber's Pole.
